# llms.txt for passwordmonkey.org

# Site Information
Site: PasswordMonkey - Free Online Password Generator
URL: https://passwordmonkey.org
Description: A free, secure, and privacy-focused password generator that creates cryptographically strong passwords directly in your browser.

# Key Features
- Generate passwords 4-50 characters long
- Customizable character types (uppercase, lowercase, numbers, symbols)
- Exclude ambiguous characters (0, O, 1, l, etc.)
- Real-time password strength indicator with entropy calculation
- Copy to clipboard functionality
- QR code generation for mobile sharing
- Dark/light mode support
- No data storage or transmission
- Progressive Web App (PWA) support

# Security & Privacy
- All password generation happens client-side in your browser
- No passwords are ever stored, logged, or transmitted to servers
- Uses cryptographically secure random number generation (Web Crypto API)
- No cookies or tracking technologies
- Completely private and anonymous
- No registration or account required
- Open source code for transparency

# Use Cases
- Personal account security (email, banking, social media)
- Business and team password management
- Social media account protection (Facebook, Instagram, TikTok, Twitter)
- E-commerce and financial accounts
- Developer and system administration
- Freelancer and contractor account security
- Educational and research purposes

# Technical Details
- Built with vanilla JavaScript (no frameworks)
- Progressive Web App (PWA) with offline capability
- Mobile-responsive design
- Open source and free to use
- No external dependencies for password generation
- Uses modern web standards (Web Crypto API, Service Workers)

# Password Generation Methods
- Random character generation with configurable character sets
- Entropy-based strength calculation
- Option to exclude similar-looking characters (0/O, 1/l, etc.)
- Support for memorable passphrases (planned feature)
- Diceware method support (planned feature)

# Comparison with Other Tools
- Free alternative to LastPass, Dashlane, Bitwarden generators
- No account creation required
- No data collection or storage
- Focused solely on password generation
- Open source transparency
- No premium features or limitations

# Limitations
- No password storage or management
- No auto-fill functionality
- No browser extension
- No team collaboration features
- No password sharing capabilities
- No password history or recovery

# Contact & Support
- Free to use with no restrictions
- No customer support (self-service tool)
- Donations accepted for server costs and development
- Privacy-focused design philosophy
- Community-driven improvements

# Related Content
- Password Security Guide: /password-security-guide.html
- About: /about.html
- Privacy Policy: /privacy.html
- FAQ: /faq.html
- Donate: /donate.html

# Best Practices Promoted
- Use passwords 12+ characters long
- Include uppercase, lowercase, numbers, and symbols
- Avoid common words and patterns
- Use unique passwords for each account
- Consider using a password manager for storage
- Enable two-factor authentication when available
- Regularly update passwords for critical accounts

# Target Audience
- General internet users seeking password security
- Developers and IT professionals
- Small business owners and freelancers
- Privacy-conscious individuals
- Educational institutions and students
- Anyone needing secure password generation

# Last Updated
Last Updated: January 2024
Version: 1.0
